body:
The `dtype` in the result of a merge is inconsistent with the equivalent pandas merge for the same inputs:
cuDF:
```
>>> df1=cudf.DataFrame({"a":[1,2,3,4]})
>>> df2=cudf.DataFrame(columns=["a"])
>>> r=df2.merge(df1,how="outer")
>>> df1["a"].dtype
dtype('int64')
>>> r["a"].dtype
dtype('float64')
```
pandas:
```
>>> pdf1=pd.DataFrame({"a":[1,2,3,4]})
>>> pdf2=pd.DataFrame(columns=["a"])
>>> pr=pdf2.merge(pdf1,how="outer")
>>> pdf1["a"].dtype
dtype('int64')
>>> pr["a"].dtype
dtype('int64')
```

Otherwise, please respond with a comment indicating any updates or changes to the original issue and/or confirm this issue still needs to be addressed. I prefer cuDF's behavior in not changing the type. Please let me know if you would like to re-open.
@GregoryKimball did you perhaps look at the examples backwards? I think cuDF _is_ changing the dtype where pandas is not.
I think this is also related to #14599

title: [BUG] `DataFrame.merge` does not assign `dtype` as expected in result as pandas does
